verses.verse: The burden <WH4853> of the word <WH1697> of the Lord <WH3068> in the land <WH776> of Hadrach <WH2317>, and Damascus <WH1834> shall be the rest <WH4496> there <WH5869>: when the eyes of man <WH120>, as of all the tribes <WH7626> of Israel <WH3478>, shall be toward the Lord <WH3068>.
And Hamath <WH2574> also shall border <WH1379> thereby <WH6865>; Tyrus, and Zidon <WH6721>, though it be very <WH3966> wise <WH2449>.
And Tyrus <WH6865> did build <WH1129> herself a strong hold <WH4692>, and heaped up <WH6651> silver <WH3701> as the dust <WH6083>, and fine gold <WH2742> as the mire <WH2916> of the streets <WH2351>.
Behold <WH136>, the Lord will cast her out <WH3423>, and he will strike <WH5221> her power <WH2428> in the sea <WH3220>; and she shall be devoured <WH398> with fire <WH784>.

Ashkelon <WH831> shall see <WH7200> it <WH3372>, and fear; Gaza <WH5804> also shall see it <WH3966>, and be very sorrowful <WH2342>, and Ekron <WH6138>; for her expectation <WH4007> shall be ashamed <WH3001>; and the king <WH4428> shall perish <WH6> from Gaza <WH5804>, and Ashkelon <WH831> shall not be inhabited <WH3427>.
And a bastard <WH4464> shall live <WH3427> in Ashdod <WH795>, and I will cut off <WH3772> the pride <WH1347> of the Philistines <WH6430>.

And I will take away <WH5493> his blood <WH1818> out of his mouth <WH6310>, and his abominations <WH8251> from between his teeth <WH8127>: but he that remains <WH7604>, even he <WH430>, shall be for our God, and he shall be as a governor <WH441> in Judah <WH3063>, and Ekron <WH6138> as a Jebusite <WH2983>.

And I will encamp <WH2583> about my house <WH1004> because of the army <WH4675>, because of him that passes by <WH5674>, and because of him that returns <WH7725>: and no oppressor <WH5065> shall pass through <WH5674> them any more <WH7200>: for now have I seen with my eyes <WH5869>.

Rejoice <WH1523> greatly <WH3966>, O daughter <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726>; shout <WH7321>, O daughter <WH1323> of Jerusalem <WH3389>: behold <WH4428>, your King comes <WH935> unto you <WH6662>: he is just, and having salvation <WH3467>; lowly <WH6041>, and riding <WH7392> upon a donkey <WH2543>, and upon a colt <WH5895> the foal <WH1121> of a donkey <WH860>.

And I will cut off <WH3772> the chariot <WH7393> from Ephraim <WH669>, and the horse <WH5483> from Jerusalem <WH3389>, and the battle <WH4421> bow <WH7198> shall be cut off <WH3772>: and he shall speak <WH1696> peace <WH7965> unto the heathen <WH1471>: and his dominion <WH4915> shall be from sea <WH3220> even to sea <WH3220>, and from the river <WH5104> even to the ends <WH657> of the earth <WH776>.
As for you also <WH1818>, by the blood of your covenant <WH1285> I have sent forth <WH7971> your prisoners <WH615> out of the pit <WH953> where is no water <WH4325>.
Turn <WH7725> you to the strong hold <WH1225>, you prisoners <WH615> of hope <WH8615>: even to day <WH3117> do I declare <WH5046> that I will render <WH7725> double unto you <WH4932>;

When I have bent <WH1869> Judah <WH3063> for me <WH4390>, filled the bow <WH7198> with Ephraim <WH669>, and raised up <WH5782> your sons <WH1121>, O Zion <WH6726>, against your sons <WH1121>, O Greece <WH3120>, and made <WH7760> you as the sword <WH2719> of a mighty man <WH1368>.

And the Lord <WH3068> shall be seen <WH7200> over them <WH2671>, and his arrow shall go forth <WH3318> as the lightning <WH1300>: and the Lord <WH136> God <WH3069> shall blow <WH8628> the trumpet <WH7782>, and shall go <WH1980> with whirlwinds <WH5591> of the south <WH8486>.

The Lord <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> shall defend <WH1598> them <WH398>; and they shall devour, and subdue <WH3533> with sling <WH7050> stones <WH68>; and they shall drink <WH8354>, and make a noise <WH1993> as through wine <WH3196>; and they shall be filled <WH4390> like bowls <WH4219>, and as the corners <WH2106> of the altar <WH4196>.

And the Lord <WH3068> their God <WH430> shall save <WH3467> them in that day <WH3117> as the flock <WH6629> of his people <WH5971>: for they shall be as the stones <WH68> of a crown <WH5145>, lifted up as a ensign <WH5264> upon his land <WH127>.
For how great is his goodness <WH2898>, and how great is his beauty <WH3308>! corn <WH1715> shall make the young men <WH970> cheerful <WH5107>, and new wine <WH8492> the maids <WH1330>.
